Group1.definition: To exist in large numbers or amounts.
Lacking a defined shape or form; vague.
Severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance; plain and simple.
To give a false impression; to contradict.
Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
Intellectual rather than emotional or physical.
Pleasant because of personality, qualities, or interests that are similar to one's own.
Easily seen or noticed; attracting attention.
Hasty and therefore not thorough or detailed.
Intimidating or causing one to feel apprehensive.
To worship or regard as a god.
Intended to teach, often in a way that is overly moralistic or patronizing.
To spread or disperse widely.
Possible to do easily or conveniently.
To openly disregard a rule or convention.
Consisting of parts or elements that are all the same kind.
Lacking excitement or variety; dull.
Lacking flavor, vigor, or interest.
Tending to talk a great deal; talkative.
Having a dislike of humankind.
A wrong or inaccurate name or designation.
Failing to take proper care in doing something.
Excessively eager to please or obey.
To make someone less angry or hostile.
A tendency to choose or do something regularly.
Childishly silly and immature.
Extremely idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
A person who spends money extravagantly.
Reserved or uncommunicative in speech.
Feeling or showing caution about possible dangers.

Group2.definition: To make something poorer in quality by adding another substance.
Verb: To publicly recommend or support. Noun: A person who publicly supports a cause or policy.
To increase the power, status, or wealth of someone or something.
Brisk and cheerful readiness.
Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone.
To make something better or improve it.
Open and responsive to suggestions; easily persuaded or controlled.
Belonging to a period other than the one being portrayed; outdated.
Showing a willingness to take bold risks; daring or impudent.
Having an extreme greed for wealth or material gain.
Lacking in originality, so as to be obvious and boring.
Gentle and kind; not harmful.
Bold and without shame.
A false statement made to damage someone’s reputation; slander.
Truthful and straightforward; frank.
To criticize or punish someone severely.
Sarcastic in a scathing and bitter way; capable of burning or corroding.
To interpret or understand something in a particular way.
Feeling or expressing remorse or penitence.
Extremely complex and difficult to follow.
To desire something belonging to someone else.
Lacking in courage; cowardly.
Behavior in keeping with good taste and propriety.
Demonstrating skill and cleverness.
To raise doubts or objections; to hesitate.
Adjective: Imitative of another person’s work; unoriginal. Noun: Something based on another source.
To remove the moisture from something; to dry thoroughly.
A forceful and bitter verbal attack.
Unwilling or unable to believe something; skeptical.

Group3.definition: To reduce in amount, degree, or intensity.
To formally renounce or reject something.
Deviating from what is standard, normal, or expected.
A deep-seated feeling of dislike or aversion.
Understood by few; mysterious or secret.
Involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring.
Without deceit or guile; innocent and simple.
Characterized by severe self-discipline and abstention from indulgence; a person who practices severe self-discipline and abstains from all forms of indulgence.
To make an unpleasant feeling less intense; to relieve.
To reveal or disclose something unintentionally; to be disloyal to someone.
Relating to the pleasant aspects of the countryside and country life.
To begin to grow or increase rapidly.
Involving or producing a harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.
To officially declare a person to be a saint or to treat someone or something as a great or important figure.
To express severe disapproval of someone or something, typically in a formal statement; an expression of severe disapproval.
The use of trickery to achieve a political, financial, or legal purpose.
To come together to form one mass or whole.
Clear, logical, and convincing.
Evoking interest, attention, or admiration in a powerfully irresistible way.
To struggle to overcome a difficulty or to argue or assert something in a debate.
Abundant in supply or quantity.
Familiar with and at ease in many different countries and cultures; a person who is familiar with and comfortable in many different cultures.
Respectful submission or yielding to the judgment, opinion, or will of another.
Lacking a clear plan or purpose; aimless.
Modest or shy because of a lack of self-confidence.
Slow to act or procrastinating.
To use ambiguous language to conceal the truth or avoid committing to a position.
To divide or cause to divide into two sharply contrasting groups or opinions.
Spending money or resources freely and recklessly; a person who spends money in an extravagant, wasteful way.
Using more words than necessary; wordy.
